titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Therese Tag Ratliff scrapbook
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: This scrapbook largely documents student life at Stanford from 1909-1911, with a few items pertaining to summer activities. Included are letters, clippings, receipts, tickets, notes, postcards, photographs, programs, class registration cards, dance cards, calling cards, a few completed essay tests, pen and pencil sketches, and manuscript and typescript poems. Of note are an agreement from Anna Kennicott and Gertrude Mathiason to sell Tessie Tag the furnishings from room 20 of Roble Hall, 1909; regulations of Roble Dining Hall, ca. 1909; and an inventory of camp outfit for summer geology, 1909.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Therese Tag Ratliff Scrapbook (SC0591). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Therese (Tessie) Tag earned her B.A. in German at Stanford University in 1915; as a student she was a member of the German Club and Schubert Club. She married Samuel A. Ratliff in 1917.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: This scrapbook largely documents student life at Stanford from 1909-1911, with a few items pertaining to summer activities. Included are letters, clippings, receipts, tickets, notes, postcards, photographs, programs, class registration cards, dance cards, calling cards, a few completed essay tests, pen and pencil sketches, and manuscript and typescript poems. Of note are an agreement from Anna Kennicott and Gertrude Mathiason to sell Tessie Tag the furnishings from room 20 of Roble Hall, 1909; regulations of Roble Dining Hall, ca. 1909; and an inventory of camp outfit for summer geology, 1909.
